thread.title: Kenya: Makueni 'Diverted Sh5.7 Million to Travels'
thread.title_full: Kenya: Makueni 'Diverted Sh5.7 Million to Travels'

title: Kenya: Makueni 'Diverted Sh5.7 Million to Travels'
text:
Kenya: Lamu Old Town Will Only Allow Donkeys 
He said after the suspension of the county government last year, the county treasury was only allowed to spend on basic operations and essential services. 
These services include procurement of drugs, fuelling of cars and payment of salaries for continuity of operations, Musyimi said. 
He said the assembly violated the PFM Act by making withdrawals from the county revenue account before approval. 
Musyimi testified at the Kenyatta International Convention Centre before a tribunal considering whether to disband the county government on grounds it is constantly fighting. 
"We had not received any requisition for travel expenditure before and during the time the travels were made," he told the tribunal led by lawyer Mohamed Nyaoga. 
Musyimi said even if the trips were needed, the assembly should have evaluated and approved proposals before the money was spent. 
The tribunal has summoned top security commanders to explain a shooting incident at the county offices. 
They include county commissioner David Oleshege and county police commander Waithera Kipsom. Kenya
